news.title: Listen: Ellie Kemper Reads ‘When Mothers Bully Back’
news.description: This week on Modern Love: The Podcast, the “Unbreakable Kimmy Schmidt” star tells the story of a woman who tests the limits of parental protectiveness.

news.author: ROD NORDLAND
news.title: An Acclaimed Photographer in Bangladesh Says He Was Tortured
news.description: Shahidul Alam, Bangladesh’s best-known photojournalist, was arrested after posting Facebook video in which he appeared to criticize the government’s handling of recent student-led protests.

news.author: SEWELL CHAN
news.title: Joseph Kabila, Congo Strongman, Will Step Down After 17 Years in Power
news.description: Joseph Kabila, shown speaking before Parliament in Kinshasa last month, announced Wednesday that he will not seek a third term as President.

news.description: The regulator is examining whether Mr. Musk’s statement was truthful and inquired why the disclosure was made on Twitter.

news.author: Paul Berger
news.title: New York City Council Votes to Cap Uber and Lyft
news.description: New York plans to cap ride-hailing services including Uber and Lyft, becoming the first U.S. city to take such a step.

news.title: Uber Hit With Cap as New York City Takes Lead in Crackdown
news.description: Drivers of for-hire vehicles on Wednesday demonstrated in support of a cap on ride-hail vehicles outside City Hall.

news.author: Nick Timiraos
news.title: CBO: Debt Will Rise to ‘Unsustainable’ Levels if Congress Extends Tax Cuts, Maintains Spending
news.description: Extending recently approved spending increases and tax cuts would create an “unsustainable” fiscal outlook, the Congressional Budget Office said in a report published Wednesday.

news.author: Nicolas Parasie
news.title: Saudi Billionaire Resumes Global Deal-Making
news.description: Saudi Prince al-Waleed bin Talal’s $500 million spending spree on technology firms this week marks the billionaire’s return to international deal-making, after he was ensnared in a corruption crackdown at home.

news.author: Brian X. Chen
news.title: The Internet Trolls Have Won. Sorry, There’s Not Much You Can Do.
news.description: When it comes to online comments and discourse and what you can do to limit their toxicity, you only have a certain amount of power. The real leverage lies with the tech companies.

news.title: U.S. to Issue New Sanctions Against Russia Over Spy Poisoning
news.description: The Trump administration announced on Wednesday that it would soon impose new sanctions on Russia for violating American and international laws by attempting to assassinate a former Russian spy.

news.author: Rebecca Ballhaus
news.title: The Wall Street Journal: Rand Paul delivers Trump letter to Putin during Moscow visit
news.description: Sen. Rand Paul said Wednesday that he delivered a letter from President Trump to Vladimir Putin during his trip to Moscow this week, a move that comes amid heightened scrutiny of the president’s relationship with the Russian leader.

news.author: RICHARD SANDOMIR
news.title: Alan Rabinowitz, Conservationist of Wild Cats, Dies at 64
news.description: Alan Rabinowitz with two Siberian tigers at the Bronx Zoo in 2007. He established the world’s first jaguar preserve, in Belize, and a vast tiger preserve in Myanmar.
